title-group.article-title: Improper Citation of Previously Published Work in Ghosh et al

body.p: I read with much interest 2 articles published from your laboratory titled “Pulse Steroid Therapy Inhibits Murine Subglottic Granulation”1 and “Cellular Adaptive Inflammation Mediates Airway Granulation in a Murine Model of Subglottic Stenosis.”2 In both these papers you use a mouse model of subglottic stenosis, which involves inciting an injury to the subglottic mucosa of a mouse (donor) and transplanting the injured subglottis under a dorsal skin flap of a second mouse (recipient).

I want to commend you for this great work but am greatly troubled by the fact that you did not appropriately cite our initial description of this mouse model of subglottic stenosis published in 2009.3 In your recent paper1 you acknowledge only our results, but not the development of the animal model. In the 2011 paper2 you do not cite our paper at all.

You state in your 2013 paper that “The current study is an extension of previous work, using the ex vivo murine model of subglottic granulation developed by our lab to study messenger RNA . . . ” without a citation given to your prior work to support this statement.
My question to you is why you used previously published language, thoughts, or ideas without proper attribution. Thank you.
